OVERVIEW:
Depth Class--Very deep
Drainage Class--Subaqueous drainage
Saturated Hydraulic Conductivity--moderately high
Parent Material--Loamy-skeletal anthropogenic dredge deposits
Geomorphic Location--Dredge-deposit shoals in coastal estuaries
Slope Range for Series--0 to less than 1 percent
Mean Annual Air Temperature--20.6 degrees C. (69 degrees F.)
Mean Annual Precipitation--1295 millimeters (51 inches)

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, dredgic, mixed, active, nonacid, hyperthermic Typic Sulfiwassents

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Hoeckers very shelly sandy clay loam, in 79 centimeters (31 inches) of saline water (colors are for moist soil unless stated otherwise)
^Aseg--0 to 28 centimeters (0 to 11 inches); very dark gray (N 3/), very shelly sandy clay loam; massive; 50 percent flat rounded weakly cemented shell fragments; rapid color change and slight effervescence with 3 and 30 percent hydrogen peroxide; electrical conductivity of 20.0 dS/m; moderately alkaline; gradual boundary. (4 to 28 centimeters, 2 to 11 inches thick)
^Cg1--28 to 61 centimeters (11 to 24 inches); dark gray (N 4/), very shelly sandy clay loam; massive; 50 percent flat rounded weakly cemented shell fragments; electrical conductivity of 23.0 dS/m; moderately alkaline; gradual boundary.
^Cg2--61 to 203 centimeters (24 to 80 inches); dark greenish gray (5GY 4/1) shelly sandy clay loam; massive; 25 percent flat rounded weakly cemented shell fragments; electrical conductivity of 19.0 dS/m; moderately alkaline.

TYPE LOCATION.content:
TYPE LOCATION:
Galveston County, TX; from the 61st Street Galveston public boat ramp; about 6 miles west by boat; about 1300 feet west of the west shoreline of North Deer Island;USGS topographic quadrangle: Virginia Point, TX
Latitude--29.283944
Longitude-- -94.9363333
Datum--WGS84
Coordinate source--from hand-held GPS

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Depth to bedrock--greater than 200 centimeters
Soil Moisture--These soils are continuously inundated.
Water depth--Ranges from 70 to 160 centimeters (30 to 63 inches)
Reaction throughout--moderately alkaline or strongly alkaline (7.9 to 9.0)
Electrical conductivity throughout--5 to 40 dS/m
Depth to hyper-sulfidic materials (incubated pH 4.0)--less than 50 centimeters
Particle-size control section (weighted average)--Total clay content--25 to 30 percent, shell fragment content--5 to 85 percent ranging in size from 2 to 75 mm
^Aseg or ^ACseg horizon--
Hue--10Y or N
Value--2.5 or 4
Chroma--up to 1
Texture--fine sand, loamy coarse sand, fine sandy loam, loam, or sandy clay loam with textural modifiers ranging from shelly to extremely shelly
Sand content--55 to 85 percent
Redox concentrations--amount-0 to 5 percent; color-shades of brown
Iron depletions--amount-0 to 5 percent; color-shades of green or yellow
^Cg or ^Cseg horizons--
Hue--10Y, 5GY, 10GY, or N
Value--3 or 5
Chroma--up to 1
Texture--loamy fine sand, fine sandy loam, sandy clay loam, or clay loam with textural modifiers ranging up to extremely shelly
Sand content--55 to 85 percent
Redox concentrations--amount-0 to 5 percent; color-shades of brown or yellow
Iron depletions--amount-0 to 5 percent; color-shades of green or yellow

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
There are the no series in the same family.
Similar soils are the Baffin, Coards, and Sellman series.
Baffin soils--are coarse-loamy, do not have greater than 15 percent shell fragments and lack dredge deposited soil materials
Coards soils--have fine particle size class and lack shell fragment content in excess of 15 percent throughout
Sellman soils--have glauconitic mineralogy, are fine textured throughout and lack shell fragments in any horizon above 2 percent

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Parent material--Loamy-skeletal anthropogenic dredge deposits
Landscape--Coastal estuaries and lagoons
Landform--Dredge-deposit shoals
Slope--less than 1 percent
Mean annual precipitation--1219 to 1295 mm (48 to 51 inches)
Mean annual air temperature--20.6 to 21.7 degrees C. (69 to 71 degrees F.)
Water temperature range (seasonal range)--15 to 32 degrees C. (59 to 90 degrees F.)
Water depth range--Ranges from 70 to 160 centimeters (30 to 63 inches)
Water salinity range--25 to 35 ppt
Frost-free period--365 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
These are the tentative Basford, Bastropbay, and Jonesbay series.
Basford soils--are on very similar landforms, are coarse-loamy throughout and do not have more than 15 percent shell fragments
Bastropbay soils--are sandy throughout, have not formed in dredged materials, and often lack considerable shell fragments--
Jonesbay soils--are fluid throughout and not have more than 15 percent shell fragments

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--Subaqueous
Saturated Hydraulic Conductivity--moderately high
Soil Moisture Regime--Peraquic
Soil is continuously inundated by saline water.

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Major uses--These areas are used as wildlife habitat and recreational activities.
Native vegetation--These areas usually not vegetated.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content:
DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:
General area--These soils are located on the upper Texas Gulf Coast
Land Resource Region--T- Atlantic and Gulf Coast Lowland Forest and Crop Region
MLRA--150B - Gulf Coast Saline Prairies
Extent--Small

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Temple, Texas

ORIGIN.content: SERIES PROPOSED: Galveston County, Texas, 2022. The name is from a geographic location (Hoeckers Point) on Galveston Island.

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS: The series was formerly included with water.
Diagnostic horizons and features recognized in this pedon are--
Particle-size control section--0 to 100 cm (0 to 40 inches)
Ochric epipedon--0 to 28 cm (0 to 11 inches) (^Aseg horizon)
Sulfidic soil materials--0 to 28 cm (0 to 11 inches) (^Aseg horizon)
Loamy-skeletal particle size class--35 percent or more shell fragments (thickest part of the control section) from 0 to 61 cm (0 to 24 inches) - ^Aseg and ^Cg1 horizons.
Peraquic feature--0 to 203 cm (0 to 80 inches) (^Aseg horizon and ^Cg layers are permanently saturated)
Additional Comments--Mineralogy based on the amount of shell fragments in the fine-earth fraction.

ADDITIONAL DATA.content:
ADDITIONAL DATA: Soil survey office lab data on pedon S2021TX1679502 from series type location.
TAXONOMIC VERSION: Keys to Soil Taxonomy, Thirteenth Edition, 2022
